intro: Vangueriopsis violacea, commonly known as the violet vangueriopsis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters, often with a striking contrast against its green foliage. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. The leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape, with serrated edges, and the plant prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
